intro: Helicteres lanceolata var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf helicteres, is a shrub native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, serrated leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
